articles.title: Congratulatory Message to Algerian President
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to Algerian President
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the Supreme People's Assembly of the DPRK, sent a congratulatory message to Abdelaziz Bouteflika, president of the People's Democratic Republic of Algeria, Thursday on his 80th birthday.
					 In the message Kim said the Korean people are pleased over the fact that the Algerian government is consolidating the national unity and achieving socio-economic development under the correct leadership of the president.
					
					 Expressing belief that the good relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries will grow stronger, he sincerely wished the Algerian president good health and happiness as well as bigger successes in his responsible work for independent development and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: DPRK FM Delegation Meets Officials of Chinese FM
articles.content:
DPRK FM Delegation Meets Officials of Chinese FM
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Ministry of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK led by Vice-Minister Ri Kil Song met Minister of Foreign Affairs of the People's Republic of China Wang Yi and met and had talks with Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs of China Liu Zhenmin and an assistant to the foreign minister respectively during its visit to China.
					 Both sides were unanimous in saying that the DPRK-China friendship was personally provided and boosted by the leaders of the elder generation of the two countries and that it is also the friendship sealed in blood by the peoples of the two countries in the common struggle against imperialism.
					
					 And they shared views that it is in line with the interests of both sides to develop the DPRK-China friendship, common treasure of the peoples of the two countries, generation after generation, and made a deep discussion on the issues of boosting the bilateral friendly relations.
					
					 Both sides had a candid exchange of opinions on the issues of mutual concern including the situation on the Korean peninsula.

articles.title: KPA General Staff Warns Aggressors of Merciless Nuclear Counter-action of Justice
articles.content:
KPA General Staff Warns Aggressors of Merciless Nuclear Counter-action of Justice
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the General Staff of the Korean People's Army (KPA) issued the following statement Thursday as the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet warmongers kicked off joint military exercises for aggression against the DPRK on Wednesday:
					 The largest-ever war drills will reportedly be staged by unprecedentedly huge aggressor forces including the U.S. imperialist forces present in south Korea, reinforced U.S. forces from overseas, south Korean puppet troops and forces of various vassal states. To be involved in this muscle-flexing are various type strategic assets such as striking groups of U.S. nuclear carriers Ronald Reagan and Carl Vinson, nuclear submarines, nuclear strategic bombers, stealth fighters and Aegis destroyers.
					
					 Lots of U.S. war operation groups and nuclear strike means deployed in south Korea and in its vicinity have already begun moving to the positions for invasion of the north.
					
					 The enemies openly announced that Key Resolve and Foal Eagle this year would involve rehearsals for putting into a more concrete shape the 4D operation for preemptive attack on the DPRK and, at the same time, drills under the simulated conditions of deployment of THAAD.
					
					 The above-said saber-rattling assumes ever-growing danger as it is under way after the U.S. imperialists secretly introduced at least 6 million tons of ammunition and war hardware into south Korea from the end of last year and took recently even the measure for urgent evacuation of  families of U.S. forces in south Korea and those with U.S. citizenship staying there.
					
					 In view of the prevailing grave situation the General Staff of the KPA clarifies the following principled stand of the revolutionary armed forces of the DPRK:
					
					 1. Now that the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces again kicked off the dangerous nuclear war drills against the DPRK at its doorstep, our army will counter them with the toughest counteractions as it had already declared.
					
					 This stand of ours clarified before the world is by no means an empty talk.
					
					 2. Should the U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet forces fire even a single shell into the waters where the sovereignty of our Republic is exercised, the KPA will immediately launch its merciless military counter-actions.
					
					 They should not forget that our revolutionary armed forces have everything in place and are always on alert.
					
					 3. The forces of vassal countries will be targets of our strikes as they are imprudently involved in the on-going saber-rattling, toeing the U.S. imperialists' hostile policy towards the DPRK.
					
					 They have to bear in mind that those lackeys have always met a miserable fate for recklessly running wild, backed by their master.
					
					 The KPA will mercilessly foil the nuclear war racket of the aggressors with its treasured nuclear sword of justice.

articles.title: Japan's Apology and Reparation for Sexual Slavery Demanded
articles.content:
Japan's Apology and Reparation for Sexual Slavery Demanded
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- A spokesman for the Korean Committee on Measures for the Sexual Slavery for Imperial Japanese Army and Drafting Victims released a statement on Thursday as regards the Japanese reactionaries' evermore undisguised moves to cover up the issue of sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and the south Korean puppet authorities' flattery and submission to them.
					 As already reported, the Japanese reactionaries demanded the south Korean authorities remove the statues of girl sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army standing in front of the Japanese embassy in Seoul and its consulate general in Pusan from the outset of the new year and recalled their ambassador and consul general. They are, at the same time, pressurizing the south Korean puppet regime to cancel the plan for erecting the statue of girl sexual slave on Tok Islets whose project is being promoted by Kyonggi Province and change the name of the statue into "statue of comfort girl".
					
					 Meanwhile, they are insisting that they would not send back their ambassador and consul general unless the girl statues are removed. They are putting pressure on the south Korean puppet regime almost every day to implement the "south Korea-Japan agreement on the comfort women" while claiming that "there is no evidence proving the forcible drafting by the Japanese army" and "south Korea should not expect the normalization of Japan-south Korea relations unless it shows moves to remove the statues." 
					
					 The statement said that the Japanese reactionaries' moves for removing the girl statues in lieu of apologizing for their past crimes before the Korean nation are nothing but brigandish logic and height of shamelessness.
					
					 What matters is that the south Korean puppet group are behaving more cowardly towards the Japanese reactionaries, refraining from lodging any protest against their shameless and gangster-like demand.
					
					 Traitors including Yun Pyong Se, puppet foreign minister of south Korea, are yielding to the pressure of Japan, saying that "they would respect and faithfully implement the agreement on comfort women" and "they would positively consult with Japan through diverse diplomatic channels." They went the lengths of sending the local self-governing bodies informal notice to the effect that "it is necessary to pool wisdom as regards the proposal for removing statues to the appropriate places." 
					
					 Despite strong protest and denunciation from people of various circles of south Korea, they are asserting that it is "the stand of the authorities that erecting any statue in front of diplomatic premises is not in line with international practice concerning the protection of diplomatic missions."
					
					 Not content with shutting their eyes to the past crimes of the Japanese imperialists by signing the humiliating "agreement" on the issue of sexual slavery with the Japanese reactionaries, the puppet group are complying with Japan's shameless demand for removing the girl statues. They are modern day "five traitors in 1905" who ceased to be members of the Korean nation and the most despicable group of traitors steeped in sycophancy towards Japan to the marrow of their bones.
					
					 The heinous traitors should be mercilessly buried in the graves of history in the name of the nation as they are working hard to sell the dignity and interests of the fellow countrymen to the Japanese reactionaries, lock, stock and barrel, till the last moments of their dirty lives.
					
					 All the Koreans will surely force Japan to make a thousand-fold apology and reparation for all sorts of inhumane acts committed by Japan against the Korean people in the past by carrying forward the spirit and stamina of the March First Popular Uprising.

articles.title: DPRK Players Back Home
articles.content:
DPRK Players Back Home
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK players came back home Thursday after taking part in the 8th Winter Asian Games held in Sapporo, Japan.
					 Ryom Tae Ok and Kim Ju Sik placed third in the adult pairs figure skating.

articles.title: Chinese Embassy Officials Visit Chicken Farm of DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm
articles.content:
Chinese Embassy Officials Visit Chicken Farm of DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The Chinese embassy here provided the DPRK-China Friendship Thaekam Co-op Farm in Sunan District with a chicken farm, gratis.
					 Ambassador Li Jinjun and staff members of the embassy visited the chicken farm on Thursday.

articles.title: Annual Meeting of Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba
articles.content:
Annual Meeting of Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- An annual meeting of the Korean Committee for Solidarity with Cuba took place here on Thursday.
					 Attending it were Kim Sung Du, chairman of the Education Commission who doubles as chairman of the above-said committee, So Ho Won, vice-chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and other members of the solidarity committee and Ambassador Jesus De Los Angeles Aise Sotolongo and staff members of the Cuban embassy here.
					
					 The meeting reviewed the work done by the committee over the past one year to boost the friendship and solidarity with the fraternal Cuban people in their dynamic struggle to defend the dignity and sovereignty of the country and the socialist gains under the leadership of the Communist Party of Cuba.
					
					 It discussed a working plan for this year.

articles.title: Working People's Organizations Hold Meetings on Tree-planting Day
articles.content:
Working People's Organizations Hold Meetings on Tree-planting Day
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- A spring tree-planting campaign began in the DPRK on the occasion of the Tree-planting Day.
					 In this regard, meetings of working people's organizations were held at the Mangyongdae Revolutionary Museum, the Mangyongdae Schoolchildren's Palace and the Central Tree Nursery of the Ministry of Land and Environment Protection and on Moran Hill on Thursday.
					
					 Present there were Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju and other senior party and state officials, the chairman of a friendly party, officials of the Cabinet, working people's organizations, commissions, ministries and national institutions and working citizens from different walks of life and youth and students.
					
					 Reports were made at the meetings to be followed by speeches.
					
					 The reporters and speakers noted that President Kim Il Sung climbed Moran Hill on March 2, Juche 35 (1946) to take the lead in the tree-planting campaign and unroll a far-reaching plan for turning the country into thick woodland and greenery.
					
					 Leader Kim Jong Il climbed Mt Jangja and personally planted two pine-nut trees in the days of the war and set a noble example of patriotism while providing the Songun revolutionary leadership, they stressed.
					
					 They appealed to all officials and other working people to vigorously turn out in the work to plant more trees in hearty response to the call of respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un for the dynamic forest restoration campaign.
					
					 At the end of the meetings, the participants planted trees and flower shrubs.

articles.title: Over 2.3 Million Trees Planted in DPRK on Tree-Planting Day
articles.content:
Over 2.3 Million Trees Planted in DPRK on Tree-Planting Day
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Officials and other working people of the DPRK held meetings Thursday, the Tree-planting Day, to launch a spring tree-planting campaign.
					 At the meetings they expressed their resolve to push forward the forest restoration campaign to the last.
					
					 At the end of the meetings the participants planted trees with deep care.
					
					 This day, more than 2.3 million trees and flower shrubs were planted, at least 1,486,000 holes dug and thousands of tons of manure applied throughout the country.

articles.title: Diplomatic Envoys, Representatives of Int'l Bodies Plant Trees
articles.content:
Foreign Diplomats Mark Tree-planting Day of DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Foreign diplomatic envoys and representatives of international organizations here and their wives and staff members of embassies here Thursday planted trees in Ryomyong Street under construction to mark the Tree-planting Day.
					 They planted trees around the 70-storied apartment house.
					
					 After being briefed on the construction of Ryomyong Street, they went round houses and public catering outlets at the final stage of construction.

articles.title: Measures Taken for Protecting Forests
articles.content:
Measures Taken for Protecting Forests
Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) ? Various measures have been taken in the DPRK to protect forests.
					A forest-fire information service system was established throughout the country.
					
					A method of exterminating vermin with the use of trichogramme evanescena has proved effective in the work to protect forests against blights and harmful insects.
					
					And positive measures have been taken one after another to decrease dependence on forests.
					
					The railway transport sector developed an antiseptic technology for sleepers on the basis of home-made sodium fluoride, thus making it possible to extend the serviceable life of wooden structures.
					
					And measures for reducing wood consumption have been worked out in the fields of construction and building materials, coal-mining, chemical and agricultural industries.
					
					Meanwhile, it is gaining momentum in Chosan County, Jagang Province and other parts of the country to develop fuels with high thermal efficiency and replace wood by marsh gas or ultra-anthracite in solving the issue of fuel.

articles.title: Taekwon-Do Schools to Be Opened in DPRK
articles.content:
Taekwon-Do Schools to Be Opened in DPRK
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Taekwon-Do schools will come into being in Pyongyang and each province of the DPRK.
					 According to Sok Min Chol, a section chief of the Korean Taekwon-Do Committee, the schools will open on April 1 this year.
					
					 Every school has a three-year senior course and four-year university course. The establishment of those schools is aimed at training more competent persons and primary, junior and senior secondary school teachers who are able to make contributions to further developing and disseminating Taekwon-Do, the orthodox martial art of the Korean nation.
					
					 The schools will put the main stress on the education in basic subjects and theory of Taekwon-Do and the practical training. 
					
					 Big efforts are being directed to making those schools fully equipped before their opening.

articles.title: Papers Call for Turning out in Forest Restoration Campaign
articles.content:
Papers Call for Turning out in Forest Restoration Campaign
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- DPRK newspapers Thursday dedicate editorials to the tree-planting day when President Kim Il Sung kindled the first torch of tree-planting campaign.
					 On March 2, Juche 35 (1946) the President, together with leader Kim Jong Il and anti-Japanese war heroine Kim Jong Suk, mounted Moran Hill and mapped out a plan to turn the mountains of the country into the paradise for people in thick verdure. 
					
					 The DPRK observes the day as the tree-planting day.
					
					 The tree-planting day is the day for conveying the patriotic feats of the peerlessly great persons of Mt Paektu and it serves as a significant occasion for implanting patriotism and love of the native land into the hearts of servicepersons and civilians, says Rodong Sinmun.
					
					 It goes on:
					
					 Afforestation and protection of forests in the DPRK where mountains make up the bulk of land are an important and responsible work to make the socialist country more prosperous and provide the people with highly civilized and beautiful living conditions and circumstances.
					
					 The forest restoration is one of the important tasks in the five-year strategy set forth by the Workers' Party of Korea.
					
					 The forest restoration campaign is a combat to conserve nature, a stand-off with imperialists and a campaign to defend socialism. And the sites for forest restoration are a theater for demonstrating the spirit of socialist Korea vigorously advancing by dint of ardor and wisdom of all the patriotic servicepersons and civilians.
					
					 It is the steadfast determination and will of our Party to turn all mountains of the country into those of "gold and treasures" with green woods in the near years. 
					
					 The forest restoration campaign is an important political work to carry out the behests of the great leaders, and the greatest patriotic work for the prosperous development of the country and all generations to come, not economic and technical work to plant trees in mountains.
					
					 Minju Joson calls upon all the people in the DPRK to turn out in the spring tree-planting and usher in a new history of "gold" mountains in the great era of Kim Jong Un.

articles.title: S. Korea's False Propaganda against DPRK Will Not Work: Rodong Sinmun
articles.content:
S. Korea's False Propaganda against DPRK Will Not Work: Rodong Sinmun
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The south Korean puppet authorities conduct false propaganda against the DPRK at home and abroad, vociferously talking about "threats from the north" and "human rights situation in the north." But such propaganda cannot go down with anyone.
					 Rodong Sinmun Thursday says this in a commentary.
					
					 The commentary goes on:
					
					 Media of different countries say that the south Korean authorities fabricate the "story of threats from the north" to throw people into horror whenever they face the political crisis, adding foreign workers in south Korea are being forced to work as slaves without their elementary rights guaranteed. 
					
					 Not a few facts proved that the south Korean authorities' talk about "human rights situation in the north" to the tune of the U.S. trumpeting about "human rights issue of the DPRK" is groundless and false propaganda and that south Korea has the grave human rights issue instead. This is the view of foreign media.
					
					 A Nepali newspaper conveyed gloomy and difficult situation of foreign workers in south Korea, revealing the serious human rights abuses against them.
					
					 The human rights abuses against foreign workers in south Korea are just a tip of iceberg.
					
					 The reality shows that the south Korean authorities are despicable political swindlers and philistines and worst human rights abusers.
					
					 The propaganda of the U.S. and south Korea is a prelude to a dangerous war.
					
					 However, their moves of taking issue with the DPRK will get them nowhere. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities have neither qualifications nor face to talk about "threat and human rights issue of the north" as they take the lead in the moves to hurt and stifle the compatriots in the north in collusion with outside forces after leaving sovereignty of the country to the tender mercy of them and commit all kinds of human rights abuses.

articles.title: Those Who Hurt DPRK Will Meet Death: Minju Joson
articles.content:
Those Who Hurt DPRK Will Meet Death: Minju Joson
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The U.S. decided to hold the largest-ever Key Resolve and Foal Eagle joint military drills in March.
					 In this regard, Minju Joson Thursday says in a commentary:
					
					 To concentrate huge military armed forces in the small region of the Korean peninsula is aimed to ignite a nuclear war to stifle the DPRK by force of arms. 
					
					 To ignite a nuclear war on the peninsula and stifle the DPRK by force of arms is the invariable ambition of the U.S. keen on aggression.
					
					 The U.S. speaks in public it would introduce "4D operation plan" during the period of war drills. The "4D operation plan" is a dangerous war scenario aimed to neutralize the DPRK's nuclear and rocket forces through preemptive attack.
					
					 This has brought to light the fact that the U.S. loudmouthed "annual" and "defensive" drills are deceptive sophism to cover up its aggressive and criminal nature.
					
					 It is the traditional disposition and mode of counteraction of the powerful revolutionary Paektusan army to retaliate against the provocateurs without mercy.
					
					 The commentary warns those who hurt the DPRK will meet miserable death and horrible final end.

articles.title: 18th All-People Action Staged in S. Korea
articles.content:
18th All-People Action Staged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The 18th all-people candlelight rally for resignation of Park Geun Hye was reportedly held at the Kwanghwamun Plaza of Seoul on Wednesday.
					 Taking part in the rally were more than 300,000 people, including members of civic and public organizations and lawmakers from opposition parties.
					
					 Speakers at the rally expressed their will to continue the struggle until Park Geun Hye is impeached, regime change made and democracy realized.
					
					 At the end of the rally the participants staged a demonstration toward Chongwadae and the "Constitutional Court".

articles.title: Struggle for Abrogation of "Security Law" Declared in S. Korea
articles.content:
Struggle for Abrogation of "Security Law" Declared in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The Association for Supporting Prisoners of Conscience of the Family Movement for Realizing Democracy held a regular meeting in Seoul on Feb. 25, according to the south Korean online paper Jaju Sibo.
					 Speakers at the meeting said the association made efforts for the release of prisoners of conscience, support for them and the repeal of the "Security Law" in 2016, but they were suppressed by the regime which has revived "yusin".
					
					 In a resolution the association declared the will to make every possible effort for the release of prisoners of conscience and struggle for the repeal of undemocratic laws such as "Security Law".
					
					 It called for building an independent and reunified society without the "Security Law" and prisoners of conscience.

articles.title: Nullification of "Agreement" on Sexual Slavery Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Nullification of "Agreement" on Sexual Slavery Urged in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Victims of the sexual slavery for the Imperial Japanese Army and bereaved families, students, citizens and lawmakers from opposition parties of south Korea held a memorial service for the victims of the sexual slavery in Kwangju, Kyonggi Province on Feb. 25, according to south Korean press reports.
					 At the service, speakers said lots of Korean women were drafted to be sexual slaves for the Imperial Japanese Army and most of them were mercilessly killed by the Japanese imperialists.
					
					 Underscoring the need to make efforts for the proper settlement of the rights issue of the victims of sexual slavery, they declared what the people demand is for the Japanese government to make an official apology and legal reparation.
					
					 They held that the "agreement" with Japan on the sexual slavery issue should be nullified and scrapped without fail.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepalese Newspaper
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Work Carried by Nepalese Newspaper
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- The full text of leader Kim Jong Il's work "Socialism Is What Keeps Our People Alive" was carried by the Feb. 24th issue of the Nepalese newspaper Arpan.
					 The work, published on November 14, Juche 81 (1992), deals with the necessity to defend the world socialist movement and the cause of socialism and indicates the tasks and ways for defending and advancing the socialist cause.
					
					 The paper carried a photo of smiling Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Syrian Media
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded by Syrian Media
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Syrian media gave special write-ups to the 75th birth anniversary of leader Kim Jong Il between Feb. 14 and 16.
					 The Syria TV Channel carried photos showing Kim Jong Il's revolutionary activities and praised him for having turned the country into an invincible politico-ideological and military power despite of the U.S.-led imperialist allied forces' moves for isolation and pressure and provided the solid foundation for building a socialist power.
					
					 It also aired scenes dealing with the proud feature of Juche Korea which is making a leap forward day by day.
					
					 The Syria Radio aired special news to laud Kim Jong Il's feats.
					
					 The Syrian Arab News Agency carried his photo and said as follow:
					
					 In the whole period of his revolutionary life leader Kim Jong Il defended and glorified the exploits of President Kim Il Sung and led the DPRK to achieve greater progress and prosperity.
					
					 It is his greatest feat that he systematized the Juche idea founded by Kim Il Sung and put forward it as the guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 The newspaper Al Baath elaborated on his noble view on life in an article titled "Leader Kim Jong Il devoted all his life to the future of the country and people".
					
					 Newspapers Tishrin and Al Thawrah carried articles praising his exploits.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded in Russia
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's Exploits Lauded in Russia
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Russian political parties, organizations and institutions held seminars on the exploits of leader Kim Jong Il between Feb. 9 and 15 to mark his birth anniversary.
					 The secretary of the Khabarovsk Territorial Regional Committee of the Communist Party of the Russian Federation said one of Kim Jong Il's greatest exploits is that he enriched the Juche idea, founded by President Kim Il Sung, to make it the guiding idea in the era of independence.
					
					 The second secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Party said that Kim Jong Il is the most prominent leader of the people as he devoted his all to the people for life, regarding it as his maxim to serve the people.
					
					 The first secretary of the Vladivostok City Committee of the Party said it is quite natural that humanity is longing for socialist Korea shining along with the august name of Kim Jong Il just like the law of nature by which the earth goes around the sun.
					
					 The first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Soviet Union stressed that Kim Jong Il is the victorious banner of the Korean people and their mental pillar and respected Supreme Leader Kim Jong Un is creditably implementing the behests of Kim Il Sung and Kim Jong Il.
					
					 Speakers including the first secretary of the Maritime Territorial Regional Committee of the Lenin Young Communist League, the chairman of the Russian Association for the Study of the Juche idea and the chairman of the Korean War Veterans' Council of Russia expressed their will to further develop the relations between the two countries, praising Kim Jong Il's exploits.

articles.title: DPRK's Test-Fire of Pukguksong-2 Hailed Abroad
articles.content:
DPRK's Test-Fire of Pukguksong-2 Hailed Abroad
 Pyongyang, March 2 (KCNA) -- Russian and Swiss organizations issued statements on Feb. 13 in congratulation of the DPRK's successful test-fire of Pukguksong-2, a medium to long-range strategic ballistic missile.
					 Extending warm congratulations to the Korean people on the successful test-fire of Pukguksong-2, the Russian Group for Solidarity with the DPRK said in its statement:
					
					 Through the recent test conducted under the guidance of Marshal Kim Jong Un, the DPRK fully demonstrated its potentiality and indomitable will.
					
					 The test-fire is of weighty significance.
					
					 The hostile forces should acknowledge the DPRK's strategic position.
					
					 The Swiss Preparatory Committee for Gathering 2017-Praise to the Great Persons of Mt Paektu, the Swiss Preparatory Committee for Celebrating the 75th Birth Anniversary of Generalissimo Kim Jong Il, the Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea said in their joint statement:
					
					 Pukguksong-2 was developed with the Korean people's own wisdom and efforts from A to Z.
					
					 The test-fire is a clear warning to the U.S., Japan and south Korea.
					
					 This is completely just and legal one for the DPRK's defence.
					
					 Meanwhile, Manju Ratna Sakya, chairman of the Nepal Journalist Association, stressed in his statement on Feb. 17 that the successful test-fire of Pukguksong-2 would make a great contribution to the DPRK's development and the world peace and be recorded in history forever.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam felicita cumpleanos del presidente argelino
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam felicita cumpleanos del presidente argelino
Pyongyang, 2 de marzo (ACNC) -- El presidente del Presidium de la Asamblea Popular Suprema de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, Kim Yong Nam, remitio hoy un mensaje de felicitacion al presidente de la Republica Argelina Democratica y Popular, Abdelaziz Bouteflika, quien cumple 80 anos.
					 En su misiva, el remitente expresa la satisfaccion de que bajo la correcta direccion del dignatario, el gobierno argelino consolidara la unidad nacional y lograra el desarrollo socio-economico.
					
					Convencido de que se ampliaran y se desarrollaran mas las excelentes relaciones de amistad y cooperacion entre los dos paises, desea de todo corazon al destinatario buena salud, felicidad y mayores exitos en sus responsabilidades para el desarrollo independiente y la prosperidad del pais.

articles.title: Destruira implacablemente a los alborotos de guerra nuclear, declara portavoz del EMG
articles.content:
Destruira implacablemente a los alborotos de guerra nuclear, declara portavoz del EMG
Pyongyang, 2 de marzo (ACNC) -- Con respecto a que los belicistas norteamericanos y surcoreanos empezaron desde el dia primero los ejercicios militares conjuntos contra la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, el portavoz del Estado Mayor General del Ejercito Popular de Corea hizo publica el dia 2 una declaracion siguiente:.
					En estos ejercicios, que se efectuan con mayor dimension sin precedente, participan enormes fuerzas armadas agresivas inclusive las tropas norteamericanas ocupantes en el Sur de Corea y reforzadas desde el exterior, el ejercito titere surcoreano y los efectivos de varios paises seguidores.
					
					Tambien, seran introducidos los colectivos de golpe de los portaaviones nucleares "Ronald Reagan" y "Carl Vinson", el submarino nuclear, el bombardero estrategico nuclear, los cazabombarderos tipo Stealth, el destructor Aegis y otros bienes estrategicos de todo tipo.
					
					Ya numerosos colectivos operacionales y los medios de golpe nuclear de EE.UU. emplazados en la Peninsula Coreana y su contorno empezaron a mover al lugar de partida para la agresion a la RPDC.
					
					Los enemigos anunciaron abiertamente que en los simulacros "Key Resolve" y "Foal Eagle" de este ano concretaran la "operacion 4D" para el ataque preventivo y realizaran hasta el entrenamiento simulando el despliegue de "Shaad".
					
					Ya desde finales del ano pasado, los imperialistas yanquis introdujeron en secreto las municiones y equipos de mas de 6 millones de toneladas en el Sur de Corea y en los ultimos dias tomaron las medidas para evacuar de manera urente los familiares de las tropas agresoras yanquis y otras personas con ciudadania norteamericana. Por esta razon, se agranda mas la peligrosidad de estos simulacros.
					
					Frente a la grave situacion creada, el Estado Mayor General del EPC aclara la posicion de principios de nuestras fuerzas armadas revolucionarias como lo siguiente:
					
					Primero: Nuestro ejercito enfrentara con las medidas de sobredureza con los imperialistas yanquis y los titeres surcoreanos que volvieron a efectuar los ejercicios de guerra nuclear contra la RPDC.
					
					No sera vana nuestra posicion aclarada ante el mundo.
					
					Segundo: se empezara de inmediato la despiadada contramedida militar si los imperialistas yanquis y los titeres surcoreanos lanzan una chispa en la region jurisdiccional de nuestra Republica 
					
					Los enemigos no deben olvidar de que nuestras fuerzas armadas revolucionarias tienen todo lo que necesitan y estan siempre en el estado de alerta.
					
					Tercero: Seran el blanco de golpe de nuestro ejercito las fuerzas perseguidoras que participaron imprudentemente en estos simulacros adhiriendose a la politica hostil de EE.UU. a la RPDC.
					
					Ellas deben ser conscientes de que siempre resultaron tragicos los destinos de los titeres que actuaron imprudentemente bajo el amparo del amo.
					
					El Ejercito Popular de Corea destruira sin piedad con el justo remedio nuclear los alborotos de guerra nuclear de los agresores.

articles.title: Miembros de embajada china visitan planta avicola de Granja Cooperativa de Thaek-am
articles.content:
Miembros de embajada china visitan planta avicola de Granja Cooperativa de Thaek-am
Pyongyang, 2 de marzo (ACNC) -- La Embajada de la Republica Popular China acreditada en la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea dono una planta avicola a la Granja Cooperativa de Thaek-am Amistad Corea-China del municipio de Sunan.
					 El embajador Li Jinjun y otros miembros de la sede diplomatica de China recorrieron el dia 2 la planta avicola.

articles.title: Efectuados mitines de juramento por Dia de Reforestacion
articles.content:
Efectuados mitines de juramento por Dia de Reforestacion
Pyongyang, 2 de marzo (ACNC) -- En ocasion del Dia de la Reforestacion, comenzo en la RPDC la plantacion primaveral. 
					Tuvieron lugar hoy los mitines de juramento de las entidades de masas. 
					
					Tomaron parte en las ocasiones Kim Yong Nam, Pak Pong Ju, y otros cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado, el presidente del partido amigo, los funcionarios del Consejo de Ministros, las organizaciones de masas, los comites, los ministerios y organos centrales, los trabajadores de diferentes estratos, los jovenes y estudiantes. 
					
					Hubo informes e intervenciones en los actos efectuados en el Museo de la Historia Revolucionaria de Mangyongdae, la colina Moran, el Palacio de Escolares y Ninos de Mangyongdae y la almaciga central del Ministerio de Proteccion Territorial y Ambiental. 
					
					Los oradores recordaron que el Presidente Kim Il Sung subio a la colina Moran el 2 de marzo del 35 (1946) de la Era Juche y tomo la iniciativa del movimiento de la plantacion de arboles presentando el proyecto de cubrir el territorio patrio de frondosos bosques. 
					
					En los dias de la pasada guerra coreana, el Dirigente Kim Jong Il subio al monte Jangja y sembro dos pinos, mencionaron.
					
					Anadieron que en su camino de orientacion sobre la revolucion mediante el Songun, el ha mostrado el noble ejemplo del patriotismo. 
					
					Llamaron a todos los funcionarios y trabajadores a incorporarse en la repoblacion forestal en acato al llamamiento del Maximo Dirigente Kim Jong Un quien movilizo a todo el partido, ejercito y pueblo en la campana de recuperacion forestal. 
					
					Terminados los actos, los cuadros directivos del partido y el Estado sembraron cuidadosamente los arboles y arbustos floriferos junto con los trabajadores de diversos estratos, los jovenes y estudiantes.
